abstract.text: Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
An object that allows players to view and manage their Game Center information from within your game.
An object that provides the ability to present the dashboard in macOS games.
Dismisses the dashboard.
The window that displays the dashboard.
Presents the dashboard in the window.
Retrieves the shared instance of the dialog controller.
Handles when the player dismisses the dashboard.
The dashboard that allows players to access their Game Center data in your game.
A Game Center-style banner that displays a message to the local player.
The abstract base protocol adopted by GameKit view controller classes.
Provide your users a convenient connection to the Game Center dashboard.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Adding an access point to your game

abstract.text: Provide an interface for players to navigate to their Game Center data from your game.
An abstract class that forms the basis of event and command processing in AppKit.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
